episodes.title: 3 Why Oprah Owes John of God Victims Apologies, Accountability & Reparations
episodes.description:
Oprah helped elevate John of God—then erased all trace of it. In this powerful conversation, we talk about survivor justice, celebrity accountability, and the spiritual bypassing that still protects abusers. More: https://lissarankin.com

How do cult leaders like John of God gain legitimacy?
 By enlisting doctors, journalists, and celebrities who unknowingly amplify their image, until the truth can no longer be ignored.
In this urgent and unflinching conversation, Dr. Lissa Rankin (Sacred Medicine), journalist Anke Richter (Cult Trip), and psychiatrist Dr. Jeffrey Rediger (Cured) examine how Oprah Winfrey’s global platform contributed to the rise of John of God, now convicted of over 50 counts of rape and abuse.
💥 Topics we explore:
• How Oprah’s team featured John of God twice and later deleted all evidence without a public apology or reparations to victims
• The responsibility of public figures to vet spiritual leaders before platforming them
• Why victims deserve more than silencez–they deserve truth, justice, and repair
• Anke’s experience as a former “cult tourist” and her call for accountability from Rajneesh/Osho enablers
• How spiritual bypassing protects abusers while retraumatizing survivors
• What it means to be a bystander—and how to use your power to speak up

This conversation is not about blame—it’s about repair.
It's about what happens when discernment fails, and what accountability could look like in the aftermath.

📣 Three key takeaways close the video with actionable insights for viewers who care about justice, trauma healing, and survivor support.

💗 Learn more or join our trauma-informed recovery community:
 🌐 https://lissarankin.com
📘 Read Cult Trip by Anke Richter
📘 Read Cured by Jeffrey Rediger
📘 RelationSick (coming May 2026) by Lissa Rankin & Jeffrey Rediger

🔔 Subscribe for more truth-telling conversations about spiritual abuse, relational healing, and trauma-informed activism.

episodes.title: 2 Nobody Is Too Smart To Get Seduced Into A Cult
episodes.description:
Cults don’t exploit your flaws—they exploit your goodness. In this compassionate talk, Lissa Rankin, Anke Richter, and Jeffrey Rediger explore why nobody is immune to cultic dynamics. Resources: https://lissarankin.com

Think you’re too smart, too skeptical, too self-aware to fall for a cult?
Think again.

In this honest and eye-opening conversation, Dr. Lissa Rankin (Mind Over Medicine), psychiatrist Dr. Jeffrey Rediger (Cured), and journalist Anke Richter (Cult Trip) explore how cults prey not on our weaknesses—but on our strengths.

🌟 Cults don’t just target the lost or naive. They attract people who are:
• Idealistic
• Emotionally intelligent
• Committed to healing and justice
• Curious, open-hearted seekers
• Willing to do their shadow work and be accountable

It’s precisely these high-integrity traits that are exploited by high-control leaders and narcissistic group dynamics.

💬 In this video, we unpack:
• Why anyone can be pulled into cultic dynamics—regardless of intelligence or education
• How spiritual, therapeutic, and activist communities can become cult-adjacent
• Why shame after leaving a cult is misplaced (and how to reclaim your narrative)
• How power corrupts—and why power must be checked
• What healthy community and true growth actually look like

This is a must-watch for anyone recovering from spiritual abuse, toxic mentorship, or high-demand group dynamics. You are not alone—and you were never foolish for trusting the parts of you that longed to make the world better.

💗 Learn more and find support at:
 🌐 https://lissarankin.com
 📘 Cult Trip by Anke Richter
 📘 Cured by Jeffrey Rediger
 📘 RelationSick (coming May 2026)

🔔 Subscribe for more trauma-informed conversations about healing, power, and post-cult integration.

episodes.title: Acknowledging The Invisible Wound Of Being A Cult Survivor 1
episodes.description: Spiritual abuse leaves hidden scars. Dr. Lissa Rankin, Dr. Jeffrey Rediger, and Anke Richter explore cult recovery, childhood indoctrination, and the lifelong wounds caused by coercive spirituality. Resources: https://lissarankin.com
